channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Inaction from council on parking in area, 13th November
item.description:
Illegal parking clogging up streets when there is plenty of legal parking available continues to cause problems on oldhill. Beyond parking on double yellows people park in the middle of the street and even on pavements- where is parking enforcement???

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oldhill Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thames Water recently did a job and left a tonne of mud that flowed onto the street and has no where to go., 13th November
item.description:
It just dries up and solidifies against the pavement in massive blocks, gets wet, dries up, over and over without anywhere for it to flow away when it does rain heavily. Have bagged-up a section today in 5 or 6 50L bags (unfortunately mixed in with a lot of leaves) but feel it's beyond my responsibility to also dispose of it. Has been a couple of months until I finally cracked as shovelled some up today, was dried solid mud in the road against the pavement (and still is where cars are parked over it). Car wheels constantly covered in mud if you want to park there or shoes always muddy unnecessarily.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Samos Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 13th November
item.description:
Dead fox on main road of northend road. Clearly been hit but where it is located body keeps being ran over which is not nice to see
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northend Road, North End, London

item.title: Bikes blocking car parking bays at Manchester Square jn to fitzhardinge street, 13th November
item.description:
Lime and human forest bikes blocking nearly 4-5 cars parking bays at Manchester Square opposite 14 Manchester Square jn to fitzhardinge street need to clear out from parking bays causing nuisance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Manchester Square, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Complaint Regarding Persistent Pavement Obstruction by Household Bins, 13th November
item.description:
Resident from other roads placing their waste bins on the public pavement along Gordon Road, adjacent to 50 Gordon Road. These containers are frequently left on the pavement for periods exceeding one day after collection, thereby causing an obstruction to pedestrians. This obstruction is particularly problematic for individuals with buggies, prams, or mobility aids, and constitutes a clear impediment to the lawful use of the pavement. In addition to creating an obstruction, the continued presence of these containers materially diminishes the amenity of the area, making the street appear untidy and unkempt. I therefore request that the Council take appropriate enforcement action under its powers relating to waste presentation and obstruction of the public pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gordon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass not cut all summer. Was told it would be in September. Why is it still not cut?, 13th November
item.description:
The area hasn’t been cut all summer. I was told it could be left uncut due to some new process but would be done in September. A small area was cut yesterday by a worker while 3 others sat in a van for 30 minutes. When will it be fixed??

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Highfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Leaf request not completed, 13th November
item.description:
This request was previously raised on ticket 8399923, however it was closed when no action was taken. Please ensure the leaves are cleared from this street and alleyway between Larcom and Charleston, before this ticket is closed. Can you please also confirm Charleston street will be added to the regular leaf clearing rota. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charleston Street, Walworth, London
